network.description: override OpenWRT "network" config option of of wifi-iface directive; will be automatically determined if left blank
network.title: Attached Networks

igmp_snooping.description: sets the "multicast_snooping" kernel setting for a bridge
igmp_snooping.title: IGMP snooping

enum_titles: Congo, The Democratic Republic of the
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

radio.description: reference to one of the elements defined in the "radios" section

frag_threshold.description: override default fragmentation threshold, if set to 0 this setting won't be overridden
frag_threshold.title: fragmentation threshold

rts_threshold.description: override RTS/CTS threshold, if set to 0 this setting won't be overridden
rts_threshold.title: RTS threshold

ack_distance.description: distance to farthest network member in meters, if set to 0 this setting will be ignored
ack_distance.title: ACK distance

encryption_wep.title: WEP (Open System/Shared Key)
encryption_wep.description: WEP encryption is insecure and its use is discouraged.

disabled.description: disable this interface without deleting its configuration

mac.description: if specified overrides default macaddress for this interface
mac.title: MAC address

network.description: logical interface name in UCI (OpenWRT configuration format), will be automatically generated if left blank

wmm.description: enables WMM (802.11e) support; required for 802.11n support
wmm.title: WMM (802.11e)

isolate.description: isolate wireless clients from one another
isolate.title: isolate clients

macfilter.description: specifies the mac filter policy, "disable" to disable the filter, "allow" to treat it as whitelist or "deny" to treat it as blacklist
macfilter.title: MAC Filter

maclist.description: mac addresses that will be filtered according to the policy specified in the "macfilter" option
maclist.title: MAC List

server.description: Example usage: "10.8.0.0 255.255.255.0". This directive will set up an OpenVPN server which will allocate addresses to clients out of the given network/netmask. The server itself will take the ".1" address of the given network for use as the server-side endpoint of the local TUN/TAP interface.
server.title: server

mesh_id.description: 802.11 mesh ID: if set, the wireless interface will join this mesh network
mesh_id.title: mesh ID

dh.description: Path to file containing Diffie Hellman parameters in PEM format, required only in TLS-server mode
dh.title: DH

username_as_common_name.description: Valid only for password authentication, use the authenticated username as the common name
username_as_common_name.title: username as cn

crl_verify.description: Path to CRL file in PEM format
crl_verify.title: CRL

auth_user_pass_verify.description: Command and method used for password authentication. If set requires the client to provide username and password
auth_user_pass_verify.title: auth user pass verify

ns_cert_type.description: Require that peer certificate was signed with an explicit nsCertType designation of "client"

client_cert_not_required.description: Don't require client certificate, client will authenticate using username/password only
client_cert_not_required.title: client cert not required

duplicate_cn.description: Allow multiple clients with the same common name to concurrently connect
duplicate_cn.title: duplicate cn

topology.description: Configure virtual addressing topology when running in tun mode. This directive has no meaning in tap mode, which always uses a subnet topology.
topology.title: topology

status.description: Write operational status to file every n seconds; eg: "/var/run/openvpn.status 10"
status.title: status file

comp_lzo.description: Use fast LZO compression; may add up to 1 byte per packet for incompressible data
comp_lzo.title: LZO compression

mssfix.description: Announce to TCP sessions running over the tunnel that they should limit their send packet sizes such that after OpenVPN has encapsulated them, the resulting UDP packet size that OpenVPN sends to its peer will not exceed max bytes. Valid only when using UDP
mssfix.title: mssfix

mute.description: limit repetitive logging of similar message types to max n occurrences
mute.title: mute

ca.description: Path to Certificate authority (CA) file in PEM format
ca.title: CA

up.description: Run command after successful TUN/TAP device open (pre user UID change)
up.title: up command

down.description: Run command after a TUN/TAP device is closed
down.title: down command

persist_key.description: Don't re-read key files across SIGUSR1 or ping-restarts
persist_key.title: persist key

tun_ipv6.description: Build a tun link capable of forwarding IPv6 traffic
tun_ipv6.title: tun ipv6

keepalive.description: Two numbers separated by space. Refer to the OpenVPN manual pagefor more information
keepalive.title: keep alive

group.description: Change the group ID of the OpenVPN process to the speified group after initialization
group.title: group

log.description: Output log messages to file, including output to stdout/stderr which is generated by called scripts
log.title: log

mute_replay_warnings.description: Silence the output of replay warnings, which are a common false alarm on WiFi networks
mute_replay_warnings.title: mute replay warnings

secret.description: Path to key for Static Key encryption mode (non-TLS)
secret.title: secret

fast_io.description: (Experimental) Optimize TUN/TAP/UDP I/O writes by avoiding a call to poll/epoll/select prior to the write operation
fast_io.title: fast IO

local.description: Local hostname or IP address on which OpenVPN will listen to. If unspecified, OpenVPN will bind to all interfaces.
local.title: local

engine.description: Enable OpenSSL hardware-based crypto engine functionality
engine.title: engine

fragment.description: Enable internal datagram fragmentation so that no UDP datagrams are sent which are larger than max bytes. 0 means disabled. Valid only when using UDP
fragment.title: fragment

enum_titles: 0 - Strictly no calling of external programs
1 - Only call built-in executables such as ifconfig, ip, route, or netsh
2 - Allow calling of built-in executables and user-defined scripts
3 - Allow passwords to be passed to scripts via environmental variables (potentially unsafe)

verb.description: Set output verbosity for logging and debugging
verb.title: verbosity

user.description: Change the user ID of the OpenVPN process to the specified user after initialization, dropping privileges in the process
user.title: user

key.description: Path to local peer's private key in PEM format. Use the private key which was generated when you built your peer's certificate
key.title: key

persist_tun.description: Don't close and reopen TUN/TAP device or run up/down scripts across SIGUSR1 or ping-restarts
persist_tun.title: persist tunnel

disabled.description: disable this VPN without deleting its configuration
disabled.title: disabled

name.description: descriptive name for internal use, (only alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores allowed)
name.title: name

up_delay.description: Delay TUN/TAP open and up script execution until after TCP/UDP connection establishment with peer
up_delay.title: up delay

status_version.description: Status file format version number. Defaults to 1
status_version.title: status version format

cert.description: Path to local peer's signed certificate in PEM format. Must be signed by a certificate authority whose certificate is specified in the CA option
cert.title: cert

cipher.description: Encrypt data channel packets with cipher algorithm
cipher.title: cipher

mtu_test.description: Empirically measures MTU on connection startup, can take up to 3 minutes to complete
mtu_test.title: MTU test

auth_user_pass.description: Path to file containing username/password on 2 lines, only valid when using password authentication
auth_user_pass.title: auth user pass

ns_cert_type.description: Require that peer certificate was signed with an explicit nsCertType designation of "server"

pull.description: accept options pushed by the server, provided they are part of the legal set of pushable options
pull.title: pull

resolv_retry.description: Retries to resolve hostname for the specified number of seconds. Set 'infinite' to retry indefinitely, set to 0 to disable
resolv_retry.title: resolv-retry

port.description: Use specific local port, ignored if nobind is enabled

server_bridge.description: Example usage: "10.8.0.4 255.255.255.0 10.8.0.128 10.8.0.254". If server-bridge is used without any parameters, it will enable a DHCP-proxy mode, where connecting OpenVPN clients will receive an IP address for their TAP adapter from the DHCP server running on the OpenVPN server-side LAN. Note that only clients that support the binding of a DHCP client with the TAP adapter (such as Windows) can support this mode. The optional nogw flag (advanced) indicates that gateway information should not be pushed to the client
server_bridge.title: server-bridge

tos.description: TOS value to match in IP headers
tos.title: TOS

mark.description: TOS value to match in IP headers

lookup.description: routing table ID or symbolic link alias

source.description: the preferred source address when sending to destinations covered by the target (optional)

device.description: interface name of the to which the static route should apply

network.description: override OpenWRT "network" config option of of wifi-iface directive; will be automatically determined if left blank
network.title: Attached Networks

igmp_snooping.description: sets the "multicast_snooping" kernel setting for a bridge
igmp_snooping.title: IGMP snooping

topology.description: Configure virtual addressing topology when running in tun mode. This directive has no meaning in tap mode, which always uses a subnet topology.
topology.title: topology

server.description: Example usage: "10.8.0.0 255.255.255.0". This directive will set up an OpenVPN server which will allocate addresses to clients out of the given network/netmask. The server itself will take the ".1" address of the given network for use as the server-side endpoint of the local TUN/TAP interface.
server.title: server

status.description: Write operational status to file every n seconds; eg: "/var/run/openvpn.status 10"
status.title: status file

comp_lzo.description: Use fast LZO compression; may add up to 1 byte per packet for incompressible data
comp_lzo.title: LZO compression

mssfix.description: Announce to TCP sessions running over the tunnel that they should limit their send packet sizes such that after OpenVPN has encapsulated them, the resulting UDP packet size that OpenVPN sends to its peer will not exceed max bytes. Valid only when using UDP
mssfix.title: mssfix

mute.description: limit repetitive logging of similar message types to max n occurrences
mute.title: mute

ca.description: Path to Certificate authority (CA) file in PEM format
ca.title: CA

up.description: Run command after successful TUN/TAP device open (pre user UID change)
up.title: up command

down.description: Run command after a TUN/TAP device is closed
down.title: down command

persist_key.description: Don't re-read key files across SIGUSR1 or ping-restarts
persist_key.title: persist key

tun_ipv6.description: Build a tun link capable of forwarding IPv6 traffic
tun_ipv6.title: tun ipv6

keepalive.description: Two numbers separated by space. Refer to the OpenVPN manual pagefor more information
keepalive.title: keep alive

group.description: Change the group ID of the OpenVPN process to the speified group after initialization
group.title: group

log.description: Output log messages to file, including output to stdout/stderr which is generated by called scripts
log.title: log

mute_replay_warnings.description: Silence the output of replay warnings, which are a common false alarm on WiFi networks
mute_replay_warnings.title: mute replay warnings

secret.description: Path to key for Static Key encryption mode (non-TLS)
secret.title: secret

ns_cert_type.title: NS cert type
ns_cert_type.description: Require that peer certificate was signed with an explicit nsCertType designation of "client"

fast_io.description: (Experimental) Optimize TUN/TAP/UDP I/O writes by avoiding a call to poll/epoll/select prior to the write operation
fast_io.title: fast IO

local.description: Local hostname or IP address on which OpenVPN will listen to. If unspecified, OpenVPN will bind to all interfaces.
local.title: local

engine.description: Enable OpenSSL hardware-based crypto engine functionality
engine.title: engine

fragment.description: Enable internal datagram fragmentation so that no UDP datagrams are sent which are larger than max bytes. 0 means disabled. Valid only when using UDP
fragment.title: fragment

enum_titles: 0 - Strictly no calling of external programs
1 - Only call built-in executables such as ifconfig, ip, route, or netsh
2 - Allow calling of built-in executables and user-defined scripts
3 - Allow passwords to be passed to scripts via environmental variables (potentially unsafe)

verb.description: Set output verbosity for logging and debugging
verb.title: verbosity

user.description: Change the user ID of the OpenVPN process to the specified user after initialization, dropping privileges in the process
user.title: user

key.description: Path to local peer's private key in PEM format. Use the private key which was generated when you built your peer's certificate
key.title: key

persist_tun.description: Don't close and reopen TUN/TAP device or run up/down scripts across SIGUSR1 or ping-restarts
persist_tun.title: persist tunnel

name.description: descriptive name for internal use, (only alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores allowed)
name.title: name

up_delay.description: Delay TUN/TAP open and up script execution until after TCP/UDP connection establishment with peer
up_delay.title: up delay

status_version.description: Status file format version number. Defaults to 1
status_version.title: status version format

cert.description: Path to local peer's signed certificate in PEM format. Must be signed by a certificate authority whose certificate is specified in the CA option
cert.title: cert

cipher.description: Encrypt data channel packets with cipher algorithm
cipher.title: cipher

mtu_test.description: Empirically measures MTU on connection startup, can take up to 3 minutes to complete
mtu_test.title: MTU test

dh.description: Path to file containing Diffie Hellman parameters in PEM format, required only in TLS-server mode
dh.title: DH

username_as_common_name.description: Valid only for password authentication, use the authenticated username as the common name
username_as_common_name.title: username as cn

auth_user_pass_verify.description: Command and method used for password authentication. If set requires the client to provide username and password
auth_user_pass_verify.title: auth user pass verify

client_cert_not_required.description: Don't require client certificate, client will authenticate using username/password only
client_cert_not_required.title: client cert not required

duplicate_cn.description: Allow multiple clients with the same common name to concurrently connect
duplicate_cn.title: duplicate cn

crl_verify.description: Path to CRL file in PEM format
crl_verify.title: CRL

topology.description: Configure virtual addressing topology when running in tun mode. This directive has no meaning in tap mode, which always uses a subnet topology.
topology.title: topology

status.description: Write operational status to file every n seconds; eg: "/var/run/openvpn.status 10"
status.title: status file

comp_lzo.title: LZO compression

mssfix.title: mssfix
